main file (.py)¶

This is the central file of the program. We call this file as an executable to instantiate the Web_Server class.

main module¶

Start a web server. Direct your browser to [HOST_IP]:[PORT] with PORT being either 8008 or the supplied value.

main.parse_commandline()[source]¶

Parse the command line and return the parsed arguments in a namespace.

Parameters:None – No parameters.
Returns:A namespace containing all the parsed command line arguments.
Return type:namespace
main.start_backend(data_dir, port=8008)[source]¶

Start the backend on the provided port, serving simulation data from the provided directory.

Set the working directory to the program directory and display a welcome message, containing the program name and version along with the server port and the directories for the frontend and the simulation data. Finally, start an instance of the cherrypy Web_Server class.

Parameters:
  • data_dir (string) – The path to the simulation data, either relative to the main.py file or absolute.
  • port (int, optional, defaults to 8008) – The port for the web server.
Returns:

Nothing
Return type:

None
main.start_program()[source]¶

Start the program.

Parse the command line and either perform a unit test or start the backend with the parameters that have been parsed from the command line.

Parameters:None – No parameters.
Returns:Nothing
Return type:None
